general: This law makes sure that any fees charged for grants related to sea fishing are legally valid, so that people who receive these grants know their funding is secure. It helps keep the system fair and reliable for everyone involved.

series.text:
* Simplified point 1: The Sea Fishing Grants (Charges) Act 2000 validates certain charges made by the Sea Fish Industry Authority and the Herring Industry Board for the administration of various schemes related to fishing vessels.
* Simplified point 2: The Act applies only to charges made before 3rd May 1996 and extends to Northern Ireland.
* Simplified point 3: The Act provides that the Sea Fish Industry Authority and the Herring Industry Board had the power to make charges in the administration of the specified schemes, and that the powers of Ministers of the Crown in connection with these schemes should be construed accordingly.
* Simplified point 4: The specified schemes include the Fishing Vessels (Acquisition and Improvement) (Grants) Schemes of 1976, 1981, 1987, 1993, and 1995, as well as the Fishing Vessels (Safety Improvements) (Grants) Schemes of 1993 and 1995.

summary:
The Sea Fishing Grants (Charges) Act 2000 ensures that fees charged by the Sea Fish Industry Authority and the Herring Industry Board for managing grants given to fishermen are legitimate. This law only applies to costs incurred before May 3, 1996, and covers all of England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland. It helps the authorities provide safer fishing boats and improve the industry.
This law allows the Sea Fish Industry Authority and the Herring Industry Board to charge fees when they give money to fishermen for new boats or safety improvements. These fees help pay for running the programs and making sure fishermen follow the rules. The law only goes back to May 3, 1996, so any fees charged before then are still good. This law also says that the government has the right to do this, so everyone knows who's in charge.
single:
* Validates certain charges made by the Sea Fish Industry Authority and the Herring Industry Board in the administration of grant schemes related to sea fishing.
* Covers several schemes, including those for acquiring and improving fishing vessels, and safety improvements.
* Applies to charges made before May 3, 1996.
* Extends to Northern Ireland.
IMPACT:
* Ensures the validity of charges made by the Sea Fish Industry Authority and the Herring Industry Board in the administration of grant schemes.
* Provides legal certainty for the parties involved in the grant schemes.
* Confirms the powers of Ministers of the Crown in connection with the schemes.
* Applies only to charges made before May 3, 1996, and does not affect any subsequent charges.
* Extends to Northern Ireland, making the legislation applicable to the entire United Kingdom.
